bibl.title: Dispatch from du Verge to J. C. Bancroft Davis
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

correspAction.persName: Davis, J. C. Bancroft (John Chandler Bancroft), 1822-1907

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.p: United States Consulate St Paul de Loanda December 14th 1882
To Hon John Davis Asst. Sectry. of State Washington D.C.

Sir I have the honor to enclose herewith a translated copy of the letter from P.L. Jones Esq. of the one of Thomas Foster's master of Alice Knowles given to Henry Williams, sent on shore at Mossamedes for sickness. I also enclose his affidavit, and those of David Miller, Charles Sims, & Augustus Jasan; runaway am: seamen; Charles Sims and Augustus are also sick at present, and the Capt of the Portuguese steamer does not care to take them on board in their present condition. They are now upon this consualte for over a month, and not expecting any am: vessel for the present, I shall be obliged to send them by some portuguese merchant, vessel to Lisbon, if the Capt will take them, these men have not any clothes or shoes, but those given to them by this consulate
I have the honore to be Sir Respectfully Your obedient Servant L de R du Verge US Consul.
